abstract: The Justice Department said the deal would not be anticompetitive, a statement that disagreed with the European Union’s position.
snippet: The Justice Department said the deal would not be anticompetitive, a statement that disagreed with the European Union’s position.
lead_paragraph: European Union regulators told the Oracle Corporation that its $7.4 billion purchase of Sun Microsystems might break antitrust rules even though the United States authorities have approved the deal.

headline.main: U.S. and Europe Disagree on Sun-Oracle Deal
headline.print_headline: Europe Raises Doubt on Deal for Sun
